column2: Accounting Officer explained that during the year under review, URF received UGX.387.9Bn against a budget of UGX.509.4Bn. This was caused by a shortfall in cash limit warrants issued by MoFPED. The Fund liaised this with MoFPED regarding the outstanding monies but no response to that effect was received. The

column3: Implementation of outputs and activities:- I assessed the implementation of a sample of four (4) outputs that had been fully quantified with a total of forty seven (47) activities worth UGX.386.2Bn and noted that;  One (1) output with one (1) activity and expenditure worth UGX.10.8Bn was fully implemented.  Three (3) outputs with forty six (46) activities worth UGX.375.4Bn were partially implemented. Out of the forty six (46) activities, the entity fully implemented nineteen (19) activities; twenty two (22) activities were partially implemented, while five (5) activities remained unimplemented.
column9: advised the Accounting Officer to always ensure that activities and outputs are implemented as planned. I
